intro: Malope malacoides subsp. tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted malope, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological landscapes.
